title: Ticket #1259: Vanilla / clipped port to OpenSolaris X86/64
description: For NMI, we need to support OpenSolaris X86/64
remarks:
2010-Mar-04 23:30:04 by psilord:
Commit [17384] is plain wrong.

2010-Mar-05 00:01:34 by matt:
Commit [17383]: Don't re-fix the soapshell -> SoapShell fix, just bring it in from V7_4-branch. Also, what's WANT_SOAP_SHELL?

2010-Mar-05 07:06:41 by nleroy:
(In response to the comment about commit 17384 being wrong): What would you do in that case? For whatever reason, the GCC generated header files don't define FLT_MIN (but they do define FLT_MAX) (this is for both the gcc 4.x that I built as well as the 3.x from sunfreeware.com)...

In response to the comment about 17383 being wrong... I had made my fix indepenedantly on my branch before the conflicting commit, and, in merging the conflict, I chose my implementation. Perhaps "WANT_SOAP_SHELL" isn't the correct name, probably should be "BUILD_SOAP_SHELL". However, I still believe that this is a more readable fix.

2010-Mar-05 09:54:58 by tannenba:
I don't think this is what Pete had in mind, but re [17384], a better place for it would be /src/condor_includes/condor_constants.h

2010-Mar-05 10:19:37 by nleroy:
I thought about that, but the only place this is used is in old classads where are going the way of the dodo, so I tucked it away here.. If you want me to move it, though, I could do that.

2010-Mar-05 12:54:32 by matt:
I'll let Pete be more specific on his comment.

As for SoapShell, if yours is cleaner, sure thing. The WANT_SOAP_SHELL doesn't seem to be defined or used anywhere. So you can probably just drop it and rely on HAVE_EXT_GSOAP as usual.

2010-Mar-05 13:01:04 by nleroy:
Actually, I almost did implement a --without-soap-shell in configure.ac, which is why I did it the way I did.

2010-Jun-30 15:45:58 by psilord:
The commit I original spoke of was wrong because where is it that you define FLT_MAX?
2010-Oct-27 16:39:01 by adesmet:
Bulk change of target version from v070404 to v070405 using ./ticket-target-mover.
